intro: Lupinaster, commonly known as the golden lupin, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces long, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Lupinaster is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
